availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Hancock County, Kentucky, merchant and postmaster. Married to Jane Davison Cooper. Father of Sallie Cooper and Josephine Cooper. Merchant in Hancock County in 1850. Served as postmaster of Hawesville, Kentucky, from November 1851 to August 1855, June 1861 to July 1862, December 1862 to July 1870, and March 1872 to September 1872.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hancock County, p. 541.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hancock County, Hawesville, p. 113.
Record of Appointment of Postmasters, 1832-1971, NARA Microfilm Publication, M841, Records of the Post Office Department, Record Group Number 28 (accessed via Ancestry.com).
"Milton Levin Cooper," (https://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=89300308&ref=acom) (accessed on April 4, 2017).
